children.subject: I can understand though if to resolve the issue enrollment has to be closed. I just wanted to make confirm that enrollment will certainly be opened up eventually and won't be closed permanently even if the issue isn't resolved.

I think the issue was that people were accidentally dropped, and they want to be able to re-enroll them before new folks take their seats. Either way, these are questions for the sis team that we cannot address.
This message is telling you that the classes are now open. The waitlist is processed at 12:40am, 6:40am, 12:40pm, and 6:40pm each day.
Thanks!

Thanks for the update, my concern is, when will enrollment for these classes be opened up? I've been waiting for nearly almost 2 weeks now to try to enroll but enrollment is still closed. If the sis team cannon find a solution for this semester, can't they at least open up enrollment so students like me who aren't even enrolled in the class can get enrolled? There's a class I really need to take this semester and it would be a huge bummer if enrollment is not opened because of this issue. I don't see why enrollment should be closed even though this issue is occuring.
T?
true

Er, "changing sections or labs" is solely a function of Options.

As far as I can tell, there is absolutely nothing in this post or any bug regarding Swaps. (That would be changing classes, which can't be done right now due to the enrollment freeze anyway.)

Some people refer to changing sections as swapping sections - hence the confusion. No matter what you call it, we are referring to the OPTIONS function on Cal Central for classes that you are enrolled in.
Yes, that's kind of my point: the post should avoid using the word "swap" anywhere, because it only reinforces the confusion. (Or make more clear that this has nothing to do with the Swap feature.)
I agree it's confusing. This is actually how the SIS team is referring to it, however, so we're trying to stay consistent.

"For the remainder of the SP18 semester, do NOT use the OPTIONS (aka swap) function for any classes that include 3 components (lecture, lab, and discussion)!"

So both Options and Swap (two different features) are not okay to use?
Wait until the class reopens.
See my response above.
On Berkeley scheduler it shows no options for re-joining the class (EE16A)
As said previously, Berkeley scheduler is not an official Berkeley site so please use schedule.berkeley.edu and CalCentral.

We just got an email saying we should re-enroll in the class if our lab/discussion sections are full. 

 

But SIS enrollment for the class is closed. 

 

So now what do I do?

If not all 3 components appear on CalCentral then our previous advice still applies: email sishelp@berkeley.edu. I would not recommend not being fully enrolled in a class despite the fact that you can attend different discussions.

I am enrolled in CS61B. I swapped and was subsequently dropped from a discussion section before the announcement was made that the swap function was broken. However, you are allowed to go to any discussion section per class policy, so it doesn't matter which section I am enrolled in.

Can I just go the remainder of the semester without enrolling in a discussion? If not, what do I do?

history.content:
Edit: see @6151 for information updated, 1/29

 

(FAQs located at the end of this post)

As many of you have been made aware, there is a problem with the enrollment system this semester regarding swaps and classes that have 3 components (lecture, lab, discussion). This problem was unexpectedly caused by a system update from the vendor. The SIS Help team has done their best to help students who were impacted by this problem.

Note: You can still safely swap the following types of classes:

  • Lecture only

  • Lecture and lab

  • Lecture and discussion

 

Key Message:

Unfortunately the ‘bug’ still exists and will continue to impact enrolled students who attempt to use the SWAP function.

What this means to you:

For the remainder of the SP18 semester, do NOT use the OPTIONS (aka swap) function for any classes that include 3 components (lecture, lab, and discussion)! Doing so will result in one of the components being dropped without notifying you this has occurred.

While it is possible to switch sections by dropping and re-enrolling in the class, be aware that you will be placed at the end of the wait list for classes that are full. For that reason, we do not recommend this method.

 

While we regret the inconvenience caused by this software glitch, the enrollment managers unfortunately cannot help you perform swaps. If you absolutely must swap sections for a class, you can submit a ticket to sishelp@berkeley.edu but we cannot guarantee they will be able to process your request.

The SIS Help team is actively trying to resolve this issue and restore the SWAP function for 3 component classes. If they are able to do so, they will send a notification to enrolled students.

Regards,

EECS Enrollment Managers

FAQs

Which EECS classes are impacted by the SWAP bug?

  • CS 61B
  • CS 61C
  • EE 16A
  • EE 16B
  • EGIN 7A

 

I tried swapping a class or section and am now missing a component, what should I do?

  • According to the SIS Help team, they have resolved the impacted enrolled students. If you discover you are missing a component as the result of a swap, please email sishelp@berkeley.edu.

In an effort to swap sections, I dropped the class and enrollment was frozen before I could re-enroll. Can I go to the front of the wait list?

  • Unfortunately no. We have no way of easily knowing when people dropped a class and why. When the classes re-open for enrollment you will have to re-enroll and be placed on the wait list like other students.

Will wait list processing change because of this issue?

  • No, when classes re-open for enrollment, the wait list will function as it normally does during the adjustment period – in sequential order. If you have a time conflict, you should fill out the appropriate CS or EE Time Conflict Over ride form.

(FAQs located at the end of this post)
